- Primary porosity = small fractures / pores in matrix
- Secondary porosity = fractures induced by mining

- =(mines area x seam thickness) x 0.25 (coorection factor

Formula derived for a planar fracture
Radial divergent heat conduction from/to tunnel
Approximation over-estimates radius of thermal front
+ Nusselt number assumes turbulent flow conditions
--> more appropriate to simulate heat exchanges in tunnel
if using appropriate Nu number if laminar regime
Shallow working waters (shaft, CM and surface waters)
= can gravitate to deeper workings via mine connections
Workings = 3D porous subdomain of high K
Host Rock = 3D porous medium of low K
results depends on: Tunnel diameter + abstraction rate
Distribution of void space in mines (Banks et al., 2010):
- void space in tunnel, drifts and galleries (Rogoz et al., 1999)
- depends on dimensions of tunnel / shaft
- Voids in fractures induced above workings
- Voids in pores in dewatered aquifer strata
Permeability distribution in goaf ("fully" and "partly caved" zones)
calculated from modelled bulking factor (depends on block size and
fall height) + goaf compaction, using the Carman-Kozeny equation
- high-k "fully caved" zone = ~ 1.5 x mining height
- total caved rock height =~ 4-6 x mining height (Mucho et al., 2000)
- goaf (using heterogeneous k from geomechanical model)
- tailgate/headgate entries + longwall face in mining layer
--> modelled into a typical longwall panel considering
2) typical thickness of caved zone + 12 overlying rock layers
